definitions.definition: The quality that renders something desirable or valuable ; worth .
examples: There is tremendous value in a good education.
An abacus is of little value when you have an electronic calculator.

definitions.definition: The degree of importance given to something.
examples: The value of my children's happiness is second only to that of my wife.

definitions.definition: That which is valued or highly esteemed , such as one's morals , morality, or belief system .
The amount (of money or goods or services ) that is considered to be a fair equivalent for something else.
examples: The value of the stolen painting is estimated to be around four million pounds.

definitions.definition: The relative duration of a musical note.
examples: The value of a crotchet is twice that of a quaver .

definitions.definition: The relative darkness or lightness of a color in (a specific area of) a painting etc.
Any definite numerical quantity or other mathematical object , determined by being measured, computed , or otherwise defined .
examples: The exact value of pi cannot be represented in decimal notation.
the value of a word; the value of a legal instrument

definitions.definition: The valuable ingredients to be obtained by treating a mass or compound ; specifically, the precious metals contained in rock, gravel, etc.
examples: the values on the hanging walls

main_definition: The quality that renders something desirable or valuable ; worth .
secondary_definitions: ( uncountable ) The degree of importance given to something.
( often plural ) That which is valued or highly esteemed , such as one's morals , morality, or belief system .
The amount (of money or goods or services ) that is considered to be a fair equivalent for something else.
( music ) The relative duration of a musical note.
( art ) The relative darkness or lightness of a color in (a specific area of) a painting etc.
( mathematics , physics ) Any definite numerical quantity or other mathematical object , determined by being measured, computed , or otherwise defined .
( in the plural ) The valuable ingredients to be obtained by treating a mass or compound ; specifically, the precious metals contained in rock, gravel, etc.
